The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #22186 (build, qt: Fix compiling qt package in depends with GCC 11 by hebasto)
* #22142 ([WIP] build: split depends Qt in

Rebased 5a7c487a92beec11a33f6c41283c6b24abf1b6cb -> 6aaef5db59f9f43d032ee7336b2d48df92d8bb90 ([pr21589.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr21589.01) -> [pr21589.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr21589.02)) due to the conflict with #21375.

#### Guix builds:
```
$ find guix-build-$(git rev-parse --short=12 HEAD)/output/ -type f -print0 | env LC_ALL=C sort -z | xargs -r0 sha256sum
d5baeffc654fb2847b6c731a56ec0a55c39016b16aa2cec1cc1b83f3aee75db0  guix-build-6aaef5db59f9/output/aarch64-linux-gnu/bitcoin-6aaef5db59f9-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz
c2b36677b096e96bcfef724c9eceed559d2a63fd02d283bf10bc9679f54bceb1  guix-build-6aaef5
> How do I test this?\n\nE.g., compiling with depends on ARM (see #18536).

While looking at the Qt source code I found that the original issue is solved in Qt 5.15 (see https://github.com/qt/qttools/commit/9e6943370585bdc791caae6c83555b3aa5efe063).\n\nSo just waiting for bumping the Qt version in depends to 5.15.x could be an option.

Updated 6aaef5db59f9f43d032ee7336b2d48df92d8bb90 -> d3fb790093a765cf2114cb1d732e0066c54772a1 ([pr21589.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr21589.02) -> [pr21589.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr21589.03)):

- rebased on top of the recent build system changes
- add [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21589#issuecomment-833381710) about ability to dro
```

Could the "22.0" milestone be assigned to this PR?

> Could the "22.0" milestone be assigned to this PR?\n\nNACK. After thinking about this more, I don't want to go down this path of continually hacking up Qt. I've got some changes that I'll draft PR shortly, which should remove the need for this, and some of your other open PRs, while fixing the same issues they are trying to fix.
For now, I'm going to close this in favour of #22142. If, for some reason, we can't get that change done fairly shortly, I'll reopen this PR.

Where does this commit come from?

```bash
# git remote -v
origin	https://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qtbase.git (fetch)
origin	https://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qtbase.git (push)

# git branch --contains 9e6943370585bdc791caae6c83555b3aa5efe063
error: no such commit 9e6943370585bdc791caae6c83555b3aa5efe063
```

If I look for one of the actual deprecation commits i.e [82d02b7b95908dec16e41c5

Thanks for checking!
Sorry, I don't know what was in my clipboard at that time :man_facepalming:
